summary: Hi all! My name is Wilson.

I'm a senior software engineer with over 3 years of experience in full stack development. I've been working on high-impact systems in the financial industry, having delivered millions of dollars in value by leading the development of critical features, optimizing systems to reduce costs and risks, and improving workflows to save thousands of hours of associate time.

A creator at heart, I enjoy the process of ideating new features and improvements and turning them into robust solutions. Always looking to continuously improve the customer's experience, I'm no stranger to collaborating with product managers, data teams, and end users to identify requirements and areas of opportunity.
I am skilled in developing both backend (Python, Java, databases) & frontend (React) web applications and engineering the infrastructure/cloud (AWS) that powers them.

In 2019, I graduated from Carnegie Mellon University with a major in Information Systems and minors in Statistics and Human-Computer Interaction. To this day, data and user experience shape the way that I approach software engineering; I strive to design & build intelligent, customer-focused products.
If you think I'd be a good fit for any opportunities, please feel free to contact me!

details: Contributed to the design, implementation, and testing of the bank’s fraud prevention systems that are preventing $300MM of fraud annually; led the development of a prioritization engine to optimally assign the most critical and time-sensitive fraud cases.

Prevented millions of dollars in losses and costs by diagnosing high-risk performance issues with the bank’s fraud prevention systems and leading the initiative to resolve them. Reduced peak DB CPU utilization from 80% to 5% and worst-case processing times from days to hours (20x faster).

Improved developer experience & efficiency across several teams by continually identifying areas to improve and fixing them, building tools to streamline tasks, and establishing coding standards as needed.

skills.name: Backend Development
subskills: Data Processing and basic Machine Learning
